Hi Ray,

Tks for your advice.  

I failed to locate the manual for installing junit
3.8.1 on Linux

- snip - 

> > 2. # add junit.jar to the CLASSPATH. For example:
> set 
> > classpath=%classpath%;INSTALL_DIR\junit3\junit.jar
> > ... Konsole window (KDE desktop)
> 
> Those look like windoze instructions, on linux you
> will not need the set
> unless you are in some very strange shell,  and the
> path separator is ':'
> not ';' (which terminates a command), and and the
> '\'s need to change into
> '/'s. Also, on linux, it's CLASSPATH. So it should
> be:
> CLASSPATH=$CLASSPATH:INSTALL_DIR/junit3/junit.jar
> > 
> > # set
>
classpath=%classpath%;home\user-admin\Junit\junit3.8.1\junit.jar
> > 
>  again, try:
>
CLASSPATH=$CLASSPATH:home/user-admin/Junit/junit3.8.1/junit.jar

It is a little bid strange to me.

on
http://www.junit.org/index.htm
clicking 'Getting Started' it popup

http://junit.sourceforge.net/
on its webpage clicking 'Documentation' it popup

http://junit.sourceforge.net/#Documentation
on its webpage clicking 'Readme', it popup

http://junit.sourceforge.net/README.html
on its webpage clicking 'Installation', it popup

http://junit.sourceforge.net/README.html#Installation
on its webpage at (point 2.) it only indicates;

2. # add junit.jar to the CLASSPATH. For example: set 
classpath=%classpath%;INSTALL_DIR\junit3\junit.jar

Without mentioning it is for Windoz or for Unix/Linux

On the unzip files
~/Junit/junit3.8.1/README.html#Installation
JUnit 3.8.1

It is the same instruction without mentioning for
Windoz/Unix/Linux.

Kindly advise where can I find an appropriate
installation manual.

TIA

B.R.
satimis
